contentrichtext.text: {{lowercase}} The '''xDNA''' technology is a technology designed by [[Diamond Multimedia]], allowing motherboards which are not certified for [[ATI Technologies|ATI]] [[ATI CrossFire|CrossFire]] (for instance, [[nForce]] 500/600 series motherboards designed by [[NVIDIA]]) to install multiple ATI [[Radeon]] video cards (up to four) as a CrossFire setup and operate in rendering modes which are exclusively made for CrossFire setups.<ref>[http://www.theinquirer.net/gb/inquirer/news/2007/10/29/crossfire-work-nvidia-intel-amd The Inquirer report], retrieved October 31, 2007</ref> Diamond Multimedia will provide optimized [[Radeon#Windows|Catalyst Drivers]] and [[middleware]] for the platform in a single package.<ref>[http://www.nordichardware.com/news,6982.html Nordic Hardware report], retrieved October 31, 2007</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.diamondmm.com/ Diamond Multimedia site] [[Category:Video cards]] {{compu-hardware-stub}}
